availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Morse (Caldwell County, KY, constable)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, constable. Kentucky native. Married to Matilda Grubbs Morse. Father of James Morse, Mary Morse, Susan Morse, Wiley Morse, Sarah Morse, Melzer Morse, Harrison Morse, and George Morse. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Constable in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, 297A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton Division, pp. 40-41.
